newsitem.title: UK: IPE gas oil hits new high despite bearish U.S data.
newsitem.headline: IPE gas oil hits new high despite bearish U.S data.

text.p: IPE gas oil futures closed at a new four-month high on Wednesday as concern built over low U.S. inventories as the winter season approaches, brokers said.
Sept gas oil finished $2.50 higher at $191.75 per tonne, the highest prompt-month price since April 11, as Oct Brent crude rose 41 cents to $20.44 per barrel.

The rally flew in the face of weekly stock data released by the American Petroleum Institute overnight which showed a 10 million barrel rise in crude. The data also showed a 2.2 million barrel drop in gasoline stocks over the week and a 19.3 million barrel year-on-year deficit in distillates.
"Even bearish API data can't take this market down. It is concerned about distillate stocks -- we could see the market short at the beginning of the season," a broker said.
Sept/Oct gas oil widened to $2.00 per tonne backwardation and the Oct gas oil/Brent spread firmed to $5.00 per barrel.
A rally in product futures reversed early selling pressure on Brent, brokers said, and some fund buying was noted, possibly in advance of the U.S. Labour Day holiday on Monday.
